preclusion:
1. Non-FASS students
2. Students who have read and passed ES2002, CS2101, FAS1102, IS2101, GEK1901/GET1006, ES2660, ES2007D, ES1541/SP1541, ENV1202 and ES1601.
3. FASS USP students from Cohort 2017 and onwards
description:
Effective Workplace Communication helps students refine their written and interpersonal communication skills for the workplace. Students learn to frame and present their written and verbal messages clearly, convincingly and effectively, as appropriate to the context, audience, and purpose of the communication. Topics include email, report and minutes writing skills; meeting and negotiation skills; and interpersonal interaction skills with colleagues and superiors. Classes are conducted in an interactive and engaging manner, and incorporate mini presentations and self-reflection activities.

This 6-week module employs a flipped classroom approach. There are online materials for independent learning, and weekly 2-hour face-to-face sessions.
title: Effective Workplace Communication
prerequisite: Students who are required to read ES1000 Foundation Academic English and/or ES1103 English for Academic Purposes must pass those modules before they are allowed to read this module.
